Name:
Bielsko
Michel
Fate:
Requisitioned by Kriegsmarine, 1939
Sunk on 17 October 1943 by U.S submarine USS Tarpon east of Yokohama
Propulsion: 2 MAN 8-cyl. Diesel, one shaft, 6,650 shp (4.889 MW)
Range: 34,000 nautical miles (63,000 km) at 10 knots (19 km/h; 12 mph)
Armament:
6 × 15 cm (5.9 in) SK L/45 
1 × 10.5 cm (4.1 in) SK L/45
2 × twin 3.7 cm (1.5 in) SK C/30
4 × twin 2 cm (0.79 in) FlaK 30
6 × 53.3 cm torpedo tubes (2 twins overwater, 2 mounted singles underwater)
1 x Torpedo boat LS 4 Esau
